Package eu.kartoffelquadrat.asyncrestlib

Class BroadcastContentManager<C extends BroadcastContent>

java.lang.Object
eu.kartoffelquadrat.asyncrestlib.BroadcastContentManager<C>
public class BroadcastContentManager<C extends BroadcastContent>
extends java.lang.Object
The Broadcast Content Manager (BCM) maintains a reference to the current content state (Broadcast Content). The entity behind the reference should not be internally modified, but replaced as a whole. If changes appear the entire reference should eb updated, via the updateBroadCastContent method.
Author:
Maximilian Schiedermeier

  • Constructor Details

    • BroadcastContentManager

      public BroadcastContentManager​(C content)
      Standard constructor for a BroadcastContentManager. To be used if no custom serialization rules are required for the BroadcastContent.
      Parameters:
      content - as the resource content observed by subscribers.

    • BroadcastContentManager

      public BroadcastContentManager​(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper objectMapper, C content)
      Advanced constructor for a BroadcastContentManager. Should only be used if the provided BroadcastContent is not serializable with the default ObjectMapper. This is e.g. the case for object with inner circular dependencies.
      Parameters:
      objectMapper - as user provided serializer that applies custom rules during serialization of a BroadcastContent.
      content - as the resource content observed by subscribers.

  • Method Details

    • awaitUpdate

      protected boolean awaitUpdate()
      Blocks the calling thread until there is something new to propagate (update of referenced broadcast content) returns true if the update was due to termination of the broadcastContentManager, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      a flag that indicates whether there are further updates to expect after this one.

    • updateBroadcastContent

      public void updateBroadcastContent​(C contentUpdate)
      Updates the maintained content and unblocks the latch. Empty content or content identical by hash is rejected.
      Parameters:
      contentUpdate - the BroadcastContent update.

    • touch

      public void touch()
      Manually advises to BroadcastContentManager that the content hash changed. The BroadcastContentManager then unblocks all subscribers, waiting for an update. Usually calling this method is not required, for BroadcastContents are supposed to be implemented as immutables. The default way to notify the BroadcastContentManager about an update is therefore the "updateBroadcastContent" method. Use this one only if your BroadcastContent is not immutable and you modified the internals of the instance maintained by the BroadcastContentManager.

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      Call this method to prevent further updates. Calling this method unblocks subscribers to updates. The ARL furthermore sets the HTTP return code to 500, to indicate that no further updates will be provided for this resource.

    • isTerminated

      public boolean isTerminated()
      Getter to tell whether this BroadcastContentManager declines further updates.
      Returns:
      a flag to indicate if this manager is already terminated.

    • getContentHash

      public java.lang.String getContentHash()
      Returns the md5-sum of the serialized version of the currently stored content. This can be used to avoid status updates when the managed content hs not actually changed.
      Returns:
      the hash of the content.

    • getCurrentBroadcastContent

      public C getCurrentBroadcastContent()
      Getter to look up the current state of the maintained broadcast content.
      Returns:
      current broadcast content.

    • getImmutableSerializer

      public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectWriter getImmutableSerializer()
      Returns the immutable writer belonging to this BroadcastContentManager. Can be used to convert e.g. transformed broadcastContents.
      Returns:
      object writer which is capable of serializing objects the same way this BCM would have processed them.

    • serializeCustomContentUsingAssociatedSerializer

      public java.lang.String serializeCustomContentUsingAssociatedSerializer​(BroadcastContent customContent)
      Returns the json serialization computed for a provided BroadcastContent, using the serializer associated to this BCM.
      Returns:
      String json string serialization of the received object, produced with serializer associated to this BCM.

    • getHashOfCustomContentUsingAssociatedSerializer

      public java.lang.String getHashOfCustomContentUsingAssociatedSerializer​(BroadcastContent customContent)
      Returns the hash computed for a provided BroadcastContent, using the serializer associated to this BCM.
      Returns:
      String md5 hash of the received object, serialized with serializer associated to this BCM.
